data.text: @LaveraLewis8 Exactly. Look at the writings of Marx and Lenin and co. The untold violence that ensued. People have the right to be heard no matter how “wrong” they may be.
@JohnOSullivan36 All good. Yes, the dates on which the court of The Hague will continue the criminal case are scheduled on Friday, November 30, Monday, December 3, and Friday, December 7.
@rory20s Oh I thought you were from America. My apologies. Will be interesting to see what happens has this gone to The Hague?

@JohnOSullivan36 Sorry? I don’t understand the comparison Maybe you misunderstood my tweet. I said a politician was brought to court here because he was accused of sowing hate against Islam & muslims. A judge will decide if he did or not.

@rory20s So the black panthers were wrong? The suffragettes that we’re subject to violence for their thoughts on equality wrong? The 🏳️‍🌈 movement wrong? The civil rights movement wrong? Their free speech provoked hated (of them) and violence (towards them). We’re they wrong?

@JohnOSullivan36 Free speech has limits imo calls for violence and hatred can not be seen as free speech. In my country a politician was taken to court because he did just that. But where to draw the line. That’s smthng  to be defined in an independent court
That’s the way it’s done here anyway
... “other foot”? I think 🤔 Voltaire said it best (although attribution is sketchy) https://t.co/KUAxJlV4br

It raises important questions. What is “free speech.” If we deny others the ability to speak freely (however much it confronts us) who becomes intolerant? If we become intolerant then isn’t that a slippery slope to #orwell thought police? What happens when the shoe is on the ...
